summary: I’m reading Ms. Marvel Vol. 2 (Carol Danvers, before she took the Captain Marvel name, 2006-2010), and it’s just strengthening...
body:
I’m reading Ms. Marvel Vol. 2 (Carol Danvers, before she took the Captain Marvel name, 2006-2010), and it’s just strengthening my opinion that there was this transitional period in comics around that time when the industry started to realize that there was money in female-led titles, but didn’t yet really realize that a good chunck of the readership would be female.

There actually was a storyline where the Puppet Master kidnapped and mind controlled a lot of women, some of them superheroines, at least two of them underage, to sell them as sex slaves (I mean, it’s not said outright that they’d be sex slaves, but he says that “men sell slower and at a lower price, until a buyer with particular tastes come along,” so you can be sure that they were meant to be sex slaves).

reblog.comment:

There actually was a storyline where the Puppet Master kidnapped and mind controlled a lot of women, some of them superheroines, at least two of them underage, to sell them as sex slaves (I mean, it’s not said outright that they’d be sex slaves, but he says that “men sell slower and at a lower price, until a buyer with particular tastes come along,” so you can be sure that they were meant to be sex slaves).

trail.content_raw:
I’m reading Ms. Marvel Vol. 2 (Carol Danvers, before she took the Captain Marvel name, 2006-2010), and it’s just strengthening my opinion that there was this transitional period in comics around that time when the industry started to realize that there was money in female-led titles, but didn’t yet really realize that a good chunck of the readership would be female.

There actually was a storyline where the Puppet Master kidnapped and mind controlled a lot of women, some of them superheroines, at least two of them underage, to sell them as sex slaves (I mean, it’s not said outright that they’d be sex slaves, but he says that “men sell slower and at a lower price, until a buyer with particular tastes come along,” so you can be sure that they were meant to be sex slaves).
trail.content:
I’m reading Ms. Marvel Vol. 2 (Carol Danvers, before she took the Captain Marvel name, 2006-2010), and it’s just strengthening my opinion that there was this transitional period in comics around that time when the industry started to realize that there was money in female-led titles, but didn’t yet really realize that a good chunck of the readership would be female.

There actually was a storyline where the Puppet Master kidnapped and mind controlled a lot of women, some of them superheroines, at least two of them underage, to sell them as sex slaves (I mean, it’s not said outright that they’d be sex slaves, but he says that “men sell slower and at a lower price, until a buyer with particular tastes come along,” so you can be sure that they were meant to be sex slaves).

blog.name: helpingheroes
blog.title: HelpingHeroes
blog.description:
Here to save the day! Welcome to Helpingheroes, a blog dedicated (mostly) to giving rp help to those who rp in the marvel and dc fandoms. The admins go by Emily and Bunny and prefer she/her pronouns. Please read our WIDs before sending any requests.
Please note that I do not own any of the content I post icons, edits, or aesthetics of. All content found here is simply edited from the original media.
Requests are currently OPEN.

summary:
Steve Rogers: So you’re the reason why the Avengers got started. 
Carol Danvers: Yes. 
Steve Roger: Even though none of us have...
body:
Steve Rogers: So you’re the reason why the Avengers got started.

Carol Danvers: Yes.

Steve Roger: Even though none of us have heard of you before, and you were never mentioned once.

Carol Danvers: Yes.

Steve Rogers: So where were you during the Chitauri invasion, Ultron, Ego, and Thanos?

Carol Danvers: I had more important things to do at that time, Steve!

*Flashes to Carol reading a book called “How to Smile for Dumbies”*

Steve Roger: Even though none of us have heard of you before, and you were never mentioned once.

Carol Danvers: Yes.

Steve Rogers: So where were you during the Chitauri invasion, Ultron, Ego, and Thanos?

Carol Danvers: I had more important things to do at that time, Steve!

*Flashes to Carol reading a book called “How to Smile for Dumbies”*

blog.name: marvelheroperil

blog.description: This is a backup blog to the sideblog MarvelPeril in case it gets deactivated. This blog dedicates to Marvel superheroes falling into perilous situations such as getting captured, hurt or whatever. Note that there WON'T be any pictures of superheroes from live-action Marvel movies/TV Shows.

summary: So what brand of misogyny is thinking a 30 second cameo of a man will overshadow Captain Marvel, the title character who is...
body:
So what brand of misogyny is thinking a 30 second cameo of a man will overshadow Captain Marvel, the title character who is going to have over 80 minutes of screen time.

Because I’m not sure I’m buying this new nonsense tony antis are selling.

You all certainly didn’t complain when Doctor Strange showed up in Thor. You didn’t say anything about Stan Lee showing up in every fucking marvel movie…

so please, explain…

reblog.comment:

summary: My pick for the new Avengers
title: My pick for the new Avengers
body:
Look at me: I’m the Captain now. 

May this Cap be more consistent with her actions and speeches than the last one. 

Black Panther 

He was originally my pick for team leader, but his being the king of a nation would cause that to be a conflict of interest, I think. 

Iron Leopard: 

Someone told me that in the comics, Tony Stark is successes as Iron Man by a Black girl, and said that the movies could make this Shuri. I love that idea. Retired Tony can be her occasional Alfred. Shuri designs a Wakandan styled Iron suit with a leopard motif.  

Scarlet Witch

She takes magic lessons from Dr. Strange, who is constantly urging her to leave the Avengers and join him in guarding the dimensions. 

Ghost:

She’s essentially where Wanda was a few years back, and the two are now friends. Janet Van Dyne cured her disease, but Ghost can still phase at will. 

Ant-Man and the Wasp:

With Tony and Natasha retiring, the roles of snarky manchild and acrobatic female with a brain must be refilled. Scott and Hope will fight any ant-tagonist big or small. 

Spiderman:

Rest assured he will enter the Spiderverse at some point and team up with Miles Morales, Gwen Stacey, Peter Porker and Spiderman-Noir. And he’s in love with Shuri, and with Bucky’s robotic arm. 

White Wolf:

Formerly the Winter Soldier, Bucky is stunned to have so many friends now. Rocket Raccoon is a frequent side-kick. Spiderman loves his arm. Tony Stark and Bucky, out of guilt, are essentially each others’ fretful Jewish mothers. Either Wanda or Ava or both is Bucky’s love interest. And obviously he still is close with Steve, T’Challa, Shuri, and the goats.

summary: Carol(about the Quinjet): I flew single engine fighters in the Air Force, but this plane has four engines. It's an entirely...
body:
Carol(about the Quinjet): I flew single engine fighters in the Air Force, but this plane has four engines. It’s an entirely different kind of flying, altogether.

Steve and Natasha: It’s an entirely different kind of flying.
